Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feature]: Remove old frameworks from NuGet.org framework pages and consider the same for EOL frameworks." (#10196) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Related Problem

_No response_

### The Elevator Pitch

Let's consider removing old TFMs that have very low package usage nowadays in 2024:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ed20da11-65a9-4e7e-88c7-abaa02d4bb41)

Additionally, let's consider removing "out of support" TFMs from these pages after they have gone EOL.

### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Package updates to address new warnings." (#10166) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Added direct dependency on `System.Text.Json` and `System.IdentityModel.Tokens.Jwt` to make sure versions specified in `Directory.Packages.props` are used.
Updated Asp.Net package versions to address package downgrade warnings.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feature]: Enforce package update policy with visual indicator, notifications, and protocol change" (#10195) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Related Problem

Many NuGet packages are not updated regularly, which can lead to security vulnerabilities, compatibility issues, and outdated dependencies. It's challenging for users to quickly identify packages that are not actively maintained or updated.

### The Elevator Pitch

NuGet.org could enforce a policy that ensures package authors keep their packages up to date. If a newer version has not been published for a certain period, NuGet.org could:
- Display a visual indicator on NuGet.org to highlight outdated packages.
- Notify package owners so they can take appropriate action.
- Implement a protocol change allowing NuGet.Client to display this information for package consumers.

This proposal complements the existing [package quality score](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/blob/package-scoring-v1/proposed/2022/package-scoring-v1.md#maintenance) spec by adding mechanisms to further improve package maintenance and transparency.

### Additional Context and Details

Keeping NuGet packages up to date is crucial for maintaining security, reliability, and performance. Developers need a clear indication of which packages are being actively maintained and which are outdated. By implementing these features, NuGet.org would help developers make informed decisions and encourage package maintainers to provide timely updates, improving the overall health of the ecosystem.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "FI main to dev" (#10194) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "Unable to build NuGet.Client VSIX - "GetDeploymentPathFromVsixManifest" task failed unexpectedly" (#13832) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I'm not able to build the NuGet.Client VSIX with the latest 17.12 Preview 3 Visual Studio Internal Preview. 

> The "GetDeploymentPathFromVsixManifest" task failed unexpectedly.
> System.AggregateException->Microsoft.Build.Framework.BuildException.GenericBuildTransferredException: One or more errors occurred. ---> Microsoft.Build.Framework.BuildException.GenericBuildTransferredException:
> Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
>    --- End of inner exception stack trace ---

What I've tracked down is that we target a very old 17.0.x version of Microsoft.VSSDK.BuildTools https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/db35f736d692fe4a46357a3a2de1ea6206dddeb3/Directory.Packages.props#L79

Likely there's some breaking change that's occurred between 17.0 and 17.12.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "I cannot run Windows PowerShell as an administrator." (#13831) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Other/NA

### Product Version

windows powershell v1

### Worked before?

v1

### Impact

Other

### Repro Steps & Context

Windows PowerShell terminated with the following error:
 The type initializer for 'System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.InitialSessionState' threw an exception.

[process exited with code 4294901760 (0xffff0000)]
You can now close this terminal with Ctrl+D, or press Enter to restart.



### Verbose Logs

```shell
Windows PowerShell terminated with the following error:
 The type initializer for 'System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.InitialSessionState' threw an exception.

[process exited with code 4294901760 (0xffff0000)]
You can now close this terminal with Ctrl+D, or press Enter to restart.
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Detect if restore used NuGetAudit or not for PackageReference projects" (#13778) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

MSBuild.exe, dotnet.exe

### The Elevator Pitch

Engineering teams responsible for CI build compliance may want to enforce that NuGetAudit runs during restore. Therefore, there should be a way to detect if NuGetAudit was actually used when the last restore ran.

> [!NOTE]
> The first version of this will not work when `RestoreUseStaticGraphEvaluation` is true

### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "New dependency resolver does not properly handle floating versions" (#13830) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe, MSBuild.exe

### Product Version

6.12

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

Using floating versions like `1.*` or `*-*` currently trips up the new dependency resolver because its comparing version ranges and does not take into account the possibility of a floating version being used.

The only workaround at the moment is to disable the new dependency resolver by setting the MSBuild property:
```xml
<PropertyGroup>
  <RestoreUseLegacyDependencyResolver>true</RestoreUseLegacyDependencyResolver>
</PrropertyGroup>
```

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Test DotnetRestore_WithServerProvidingAuditData_RestoreTaskReturnsCountProperties doesn't work on Linux" (#13829) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Test `DotnetRestore_WithServerProvidingAuditData_RestoreTaskReturnsCountProperties` is failing on Linux:

```text
Expected result.ExitCode to be 0 because /home/vsts/work/1/s/.test/work/b8b994ab/08481a82/dotnet restore -p:ExpectedRestoreProjectCount=1 -p:ExpectedRestoreSkippedCount=0 -p:ExpectedRestoreProjectsAuditedCount=1 should have succeeded but returned exit code 1 after 1.8s with the following output:


Determining projects to restore...
/home/vsts/work/1/s/.test/work/b8b994ab/08481a82/sdk/8.0.403/NuGet.targets(180,5): error : The feed 'source [http://localhost:40903/aa62d06c-218a-4b79-89cd-878dd942b435/index.json]' lists package 'packageA.1.0.0' but multiple attempts to download the nupkg have failed. The feed is either invalid or required packages were removed while the current operation was in progress. Verify the package exists on the feed and try again. [/home/vsts/work/1/s/.test/work/ddcf4ceb/1e157b4f/solution/test.csproj]
Failed to restore /home/vsts/work/1/s/.test/work/ddcf4ceb/1e157b4f/solution/test.csproj (in 405 ms).


, but found 1 (difference of 1).
```

Looks like `FileSystemBackedV3MockServer` might not handle case sensitive filesystems correctly, and therefore this mock server has wrong behaviour on Linux.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Scream Test Impacting Alpine Linux Customers on 08/20/2024" (#73) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
On **August 20, 2024**, NuGet.org will conduct a **scream test** that may affect **Alpine Linux** customers. The test is scheduled to begin at **EDT 01:00 PM** and is expected to last between **24 to 72 hours**. We will adjust the test duration based on customer feedback.

During the scream test, **Alpine Linux** customers may encounter **DNS failures** from the [V3 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) due to this [issue](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9736). To mitigate, we recommend that Alpine Linux customers migrate to **Alpine Linux 3.18.0** or a newer version. These newer versions support **TCP fallback** in the DNS resolver.

To ensure uninterrupted service during the test, please use the [V2 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) instead.

If you have any **feedback**, **concerns**, or **questions**, feel free to reach out to us at support@nuget.org or by commenting on the discussion issue: [NuGet/Home#12985](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/discussions/12985).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Scream Test Impacting Alpine Linux Customers on 08/20/2024" (#73) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
On **August 20, 2024**, NuGet.org will conduct a **scream test** that may affect **Alpine Linux** customers. The test is scheduled to begin at **EDT 01:00 PM** and is expected to last between **24 to 72 hours**. We will adjust the test duration based on customer feedback.

During the scream test, **Alpine Linux** customers may encounter **DNS failures** from the [V3 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) due to this [issue](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9736). To mitigate, we recommend that Alpine Linux customers migrate to **Alpine Linux 3.18.0** or a newer version. These newer versions support **TCP fallback** in the DNS resolver.

To ensure uninterrupted service during the test, please use the [V2 API](https://learn.microsoft.com/nuget/nuget-org/overview-nuget-org#api-endpoint-for-nugetorg) instead.

If you have any **feedback**, **concerns**, or **questions**, feel free to reach out to us at support@nuget.org or by commenting on the discussion issue: [NuGet/Home#12985](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/discussions/12985).
